sections.text:
23-277.County supervisors; quorum.

A majority of all the supervisors elected in any county shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business, and all questions which shall arise at meetings shall be determined by the votes of a majority of the supervisors present, except in cases otherwise provided for.

SourceLaws 1879, § 68, p. 373;R.S.1913, § 1069;C.S.1922, § 971;C.S.1929, § 26-285;R.S.1943, § 23-277;Laws 2014, LB937, § 1.

Annotations

A majority of members present at meeting may change township boundaries. Township of Inavale v. Bailey, 35 Neb. 453, 53 N.W. 465 (1892).

If two-thirds of board are present, impeachment proceedings may be heard. State ex rel. Castor v. Board of Supervisors of Saline County, 18 Neb. 422, 25 N.W. 587 (1885).
